clean_content:
Definition / general

* Rare pancreatic neuroendocrine neoplasm producing adrenocorticotrophic hormone (ACTH)* ACTH can also rarely be produced by [acinar cell carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasacinar.html) or [pancreatoblastoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaspancreatoblastoma.html) ([Am J Surg Pathol 2015;39:374](25353285))

Essential features

* Rare lesion mostly described in case reports* Patients develop [Cushing syndrome](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/adrenalcushings.html) clinically* Aggressive, with poor prognosis

Terminology

* Recognized by IARC as ACTH producing tumor with Cushing syndrome ([Lloyd: WHO Classification of Tumours of Endocrine Organs, 4th Edition, 2017](https://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/9283244931/pathologyoutl-20))

ICD coding

* ICD-10:
  [E24.3](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/E00-E89/E20-E35/E24-/E24.3) - ectopic ACTH syndrome

Epidemiology

* Responsible for about 15% of cases of ectopic Cushing syndrome

Sites

* May be more common in tail of pancreas

Clinical features

* Mean age 42 years, with a female predominance ([Am J Surg Pathol 2015;39:374](25353285))* Causes Cushing syndrome: central obesity, muscle weakness, glucose intolerance, hypertension* 33% of patients also have Zollinger-Ellison syndrome* 10 year survival is roughly 15% ([Am J Surg Pathol 2015;39:374](25353285))

Diagnostic criteria

* Determined clinically, not by immunohistochemical positivity for ACTH

Radiology images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreasacthradio1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4713687/figure/fig01/)

Pancreatic tail / body mass

Case reports

* 27 year old woman with ovarian and pelvic metastases ([Int J Clin Exp Pathol 2015;8:15396](26823901))* 40 year old woman with Cushing syndrome ([Ann Hepatobiliary Pancreat Surg 2017;21:61](28317048))* 41 year old woman with bilateral ovarian metastases ([Int J Gynecol Pathol 2002;21:276](12068175))* 48 year old woman with tumor secreting ACTH and possibly corticotropin releasing hormone (CRH) ([Endocr Pathol 2015;26:239](26202047))* 54 year old woman with ACTH secretion only at second relapse ([J Clin Endocrinol Metab 2004;89:3731](15292297))

Treatment

* Surgical excision

Gross description

* Firm, gray-white, well circumscribed lesions that may measure up to 5 cm

Gross images

*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreasacthgross1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5353908/figure/F3/)

Pancreatic tail mass

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Appears similar to other well differentiated neuroendocrine tumors of the pancreas* Lymphovascular and perineural invasion often present* Focal necrosis is rare

Microscopic (histologic) images

AFIP images  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasacthAFIPimage1.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasacthAFIPimage1.jpg)

ACTH producing tumor with Cushing syndrome

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreasacthmicro1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4713687/figure/fig02/)

Typical neuroendocrine tumor appearance

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreasacthmicro2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2950668/figure/F3/)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreasacthmicro3.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2950668/figure/F4/)

66 year old man with ultrasound guided biopsy: H&E and ACTH antibody

Cytology images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreasacthcyto1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4264709/figure/F2/)

Scattered neuroendocrine cells

Positive stains

* **ACTH** (though this does not establish the diagnosis), **beta endorphin**, [galectin3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsgalectin3.html)* [Ki67](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainski67.html) usually 3 - 20%, as these lesions are typically WHO grade 2

Electron microscopy description

* Round cytoplasmic secretory granules, diameter of 100 - 300 nm, with an electron dense core ([Int J Clin Exp Pathol 2015;8:15396](26823901))

Sample pathology report

* Pancreas, tail, resection:
  + Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, WHO grade 1 (see synoptic report and comment)+ Comment: The patient’s clinical history of Cushing syndrome is noted. This may be due to ACTH secretion by this tumor. Immunohistochemical stains for synaptophysin and chromogranin are positive and the Ki67 index is approximately 2.3%.

Differential diagnosis

* **Non-ACTH secreting** [pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaspen.html):
  + Must be determined on clinical grounds, though **ACTH** positivity by immunohistochemistry is rare in these ([Proc (Bayl Univ Med Cent) 2015;28:46](25552797))* [Pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasacinar.html)* [Pancreatoblastoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaspancreatoblastoma.html)
